text: Mohamed Zidan (born 11 December 1981) is a former Egyptian football player. He played for the Egypt national team. ==Career statistics== ===Club === |- |1999–2000||rowspan="4"|AB Copenhagen||rowspan="4"|Superliga||0||0 |- |2000–01||5||0 |- |2001–02||17||1 |- |2002–03||29||11 |- |2003–04||rowspan="2"|Midtjylland||rowspan="2"|Superliga||30||19 |- |2004–05||17||11 |- |2004–05||Werder Bremen||Bundesliga||10||2 |- |2005–06||Mainz||Bundesliga||26||9 |- |2006–07||Werder Bremen||Bundesliga||5||1 |- |2006–07||Mainz||Bundesliga||15||13 |- |2007–08||Hamburg||Bundesliga||21||2 |- |2008–09||rowspan="2"|Borussia Dortmund||rowspan="2"|Bundesliga||29||7 |- |2009–10|||| 98||42 106||34 204||76 |} ===International=== |- |2005||3||0 |- |2006||2||1 |- |2007||4||1 |- |2008||8||2 |- |2009||9||2 |- |2010|||| |- !Total||26||6 |} ==International goals== :Scores and results list Egypt's goal tally first, score column indicates score after each Zidan goal.
